intro: Scleria angusta, commonly known as narrowleaf sedges, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its flowering spikes are usually small and clustered, producing tiny, three-lobed flowers. Scleria angusta is often found in temperate regions of the Americas and is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments.
